evidence: MRI plays a central role in this global effort because it allows researchers to look inside the living brain - not only to see its structure, but also to monitor its activity in real time.
The research priorities include identifying brain cell types, mapping neural circuits, developing technologies to monitor brain activity, and creating precise intervention tools.
MRI is a key part of this vision, serving as one of the most powerful noninvasive tools for studying the human brain.
The initiative brought together major agencies such as the NIH, NSF, DARPA, and later FDA and IARPA.
MRI plays a central role in this global effort because it allows researchers to look inside the living brain - not only to see its structure, but also to monitor its activity in real time.
